segments.text: It ’ s a program about islam . It ’ s very interesting .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Wow ! So many people ! Where are they and what are they doing ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: They are muslims on a pilgrimage to mecca . Muslims call this pilgrimage “ haj ” .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Muslims believe that every man who is able should go on a haj at least once in his life . Mecca is the spiritual centre of the muslim faith .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: When muslims pray , they face towards mecca .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s right . Unfortunately , so many people go on the haj each year that there are often stamped and people get killed .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I heard about that . The pilgrims must walk around a large , sacred black stone .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s right . That ’ s when accidents often happen . The Saudi government tries to limit the number of pilgrims , to reduce the chances of accidents .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Pilgrimages are common in many faiths .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . In England , Christian pilgrims might go to Canterbury and many Christians go to the Vatican on pilgrimages .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Isn ’ t there a place in france where people go to get healed ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think that place is Lourdes . There are many stories of people being healed after visiting there .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you think that there is something magical about that place ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Personally . I think that people believe they will be healed and that faith causes a change in their mind that cures them . I don ’ t think place is magical in any way .
segments.speaker: S2
